definition[0]: to correct or make small changes to something that is written or spoken
example[0]: The law was amended to include women.
example[1]: The defendant later amended his evidence.
example[2]: ‘Steve stole it – or rather borrowed it, ’ he amended.
definition[1]: to make small changes to a law or a document, for example to improve it, to make it more accurate, or to take account of new conditions
example[3]: a controversial plan to amend the Constitution
